title: Schwetzingen Festival
text:
The Schwetzingen Festival (German: Schwetzinger Festspiele, now Schwetzinger SWR Festspiele) is an early summer festival of <a href="opera">opera</a> and other classical music presented each year from May to early June in <a href="Schwetzingen">Schwetzingen</a>, Germany.
In 1952, the broadcaster <a href="S%C3%BCddeutscher%20Rundfunk">Süddeutscher Rundfunk</a> founded the festival in the Schwetzingen area. It is located in a beautiful 250-year-old palace and park, <a href="Schwetzingen%20Castle">Schwetzingen Castle</a>, near the famous city of Heidelberg. The main venue is the historic <a href="Schlosstheater%20Schwetzingen">Schlosstheater Schwetzingen</a>. Nowadays, the successor organization is the <a href="S%C3%BCdwestrundfunk">Südwestrundfunk</a> (SWR) and it organises many international concerts and music theatre events every year.
List of major premieres and rediscoveries.
One of the festival's characteristics is the world premiere of a new opera, as well as at least one rediscovered opera from former centuries, performed on period instruments.
Concerts.
Concerts have featured well-known artists such as <a href="Gidon%20Kremer">Gidon Kremer</a>, <a href="Jorge%20Bolet">Jorge Bolet</a> and <a href="Cecilia%20Bartoli">Cecilia Bartoli</a>, as well as young artists at the start of their careers. Singers of the caliber of <a href="Barbara%20Hendricks">Barbara Hendricks</a>, <a href="Fritz%20Wunderlich">Fritz Wunderlich</a> and <a href="Teresa%20Berganza">Teresa Berganza</a> have performed at the festival as beginners and have all gone on to major careers.
